@terence4444 Your narrow definition, it's like you're detached from humanity.
The light emitted by electronic products is basically directly shining into human eyes, not reflected like the sun.
LCD and OLED are both backlights, and the e-ink screen not only has a very low screen principle that harms the eyes, but also is basically a flicker-free front light.

Many people upstairs are deliberately ignoring the basic fact that human eyes rely on the reflection of sunlight to see things, and the light source of electronic products is directly shining into the eyes.
If you ignore the fact that the light source is direct, there is no point in discussing PWM and DC.

Maybe I'm wrong, their eyes have evolved to directly look at sunlight for a long time, and they just come to Earth to experience life. Then there is really no point in discussing the brightness of mobile phones and the direct PWM of the light source.
